title: Boston National Historical Park: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar           Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 10 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Boston National Historical Park A Revolution Town Meeting: The Stamp Act      Time: 2:30 PM to 3:00 PM,4:00 PM to 4:30 PM Location: Faneuil Hall, The Great Hall Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly  from 06/26/2016 to 08/14/2016 Join in on an 18th century Town Meeting to debate the Stamp Act! View Details      Boston National Historical Park Ranger Choice Talks      Time: 10:00 AM to 10:30 AM,3:30 PM to 4:00 AM Location: Faneuil Hall Education Space Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 07/01/2016 to 10/15/2016 Join a National Park Service ranger for an intriguing, little-known story that brings Boston's history to life. Each ranger will share exciting finds from their research in these unique 30-minute talks. Check the "Today at the Park" brochure for topics View Details      Boston National Historical Park Tours of the Freedom Trail: Meetings, Mobs & Martyrs      Time: 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM,1:00 PM to 2:00 PM Location: Faneuil Hall Visitor Center Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 07/01/2016 to 10/15/2016 Join a National Park Service Ranger for a 60 minute walk focusing on the events that lead to the Boston Tea Party. Tours begin inside the Faneuil Hall Visitor Center and end at Old South Meeting House. View Details      Boston National Historical Park Tours of the Freedom Trail®: Enemies to This Country      Time: 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM,2:00 PM to 3:00 PM,3:00 PM to 4:00 PM Location: Faneuil hall Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 07/01/2016 to 10/15/2016 In 1774 Paul Revere and his neighbors in the North End were forced to make difficult and dangerous choices. As sides were drawn, both Patriots and Loyalists labeled the other "enemies to this country". View Details      Boston National Historical Park Muskets, Men, & Liberty      Time: 11:30 AM to 12:00 PM,12:30 PM to 1:00 PM,2:30 PM to 3:00 PM,3:30 PM to 4:00 PM Location: Bunker Hill Monument Grounds Fees: Free     Friday, August 19, 2016 Every Friday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 07/01/2016 to 10/15/2016 What were the colonists fighting for at Bunker Hill, and why were they willing to take up arms against fellow British subjects? Discover what three men from very different backgrounds were fighting for on the grounds of the Bunker Hill Monument. View Details      Boston National Historical Park Twilight at the Battle of Bunker Hill      Time: 6:30 PM to 8:00 PM Location: Navy Yard Visitor Center Fees: Free     Friday, August 19, 2016 Walk in the footsteps of the British Soldiers along the British right flank of the battlefield. The tour ends at the Bunker Hill Monument where visitors can climb the monument to witness the sun setting over Boston. View Details      Boston National Historical Park Find Your Park      Time: 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM Location: Bunker Hill Monument & Lodge Fees: Free     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Learn about a new park or rediscover an old favorite. Peruse brochures from over 400 National Park Service sites across America: from Guam to Georgia, Alaska to Alabama and American Samoa to Maine. View Details      Boston National Historical Park Pirate or Patriot?      Time: 6:30 PM to 8:00 PM Location: Charlestown Navy Yard Fees: FREE     Friday, August 26, 2016 During times of war sailors are often our heroes. But what happens when the war is over and there is no more work? Boston has a long association with illicit sea-trade. But are these men pirates or patriots? View Details      Boston National Historical Park Rosie the Riveter Invades the Navy Yard      Time: 12:00 PM to 8:00 PM Location: Charlestown Navy Yard Fees: Free     Friday, August 26, 2016 Everyday  from 08/26/2016 to 08/27/2016 Learn about the women who built ships during World War II. The festive day will include hands on activities for kids, guided tours of the Navy Yard and USS Cassin Young with a special “Rosie” twist.  View Details      Boston National Historical Park Explore the Charlestown Navy Yard      Time: 6:30 PM to 8:00 PM Location: Charlestown Navy Yard Fees: FREE     Friday, September 2, 2016 The Charlestown Navy Yard was both a home for many people and a place of production and technological innovation. Learn how workers served the U.S. Navy for generations. View Details
